channel.title: Weird bug, please help
channel.description:
Ok so basicly i cannot connect to my server.
Yes i have portforwarded right, i even checked the status of my server and it was online. I did connect to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.0, i even tryed my no-ip. The server and client matched up with each other, and i have even tryed it with different server downloads.
It happened to me with the PDF (project dungeonfest ) and also hybrid pvp v3
The weird thing is, i never had this before i am not a beginner anymore and i know what im doing. This is not the first time im starting a server and coding stuff.
Any of you know what this problem is about?
Thanks
PS: Portforwarding with uTorrent (just for myself), always worked fine but now. Just thought i should tell you
EDIT: I just found a cool working portforwarding program, called soulseek. You can portforward with that if you dont have a router, it fixed my stuff that i had with utorrent

item.title: Weird bug, please help
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

uTorrent is sketchy to portforward with, once you run your server you have to turn uTorrent off and on again and some next shit. Just use your router./

Read full topic

item.title: Weird bug, please help
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Nosere, post:12, topic:433101”][quote author=ultimatepkvillage link=topic=535823.msg3917521#msg3917521 date=1329351906]
maybe skype?
[/quote]
No, didnt/dont have skype open[/quote]

i believe skype uses port 55555 anyways. that shouldnt affect it.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird bug, please help
item.dc:creator: @Nosere Nosere
item.description:
@Nosere wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:6, topic:433101”][quote author=Nosere link=topic=535823.msg3917496#msg3917496 date=1329351258]

are the listening ports both the same in the client and server sides?

Yes, its 43594 for both. My server is online on several status checker
[/quote]
that didnt anwser my question. are they both aimed at 43594?[/quote]
Yes they are the same

it appears that i can only connect to my server if i dont portforward to 43594, but i dont want my server to be offline. I dont disconnect when i put 43594 back on tho, this is very strange

Read full topic

No response from server
Please try using a different world.

item.title: Weird bug, please help
item.dc:creator: @Nosere Nosere
item.description:
@Nosere wrote:

Ok so basicly i cannot connect to my server.

Yes i have portforwarded right, i even checked the status of my server and it was online.
I did connect to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.0, i even tryed my no-ip.
The server and client matched up with each other, and i have even tryed it with different server downloads.

It happened to me with the PDF (project dungeonfest ) and also hybrid pvp v3

The weird thing is, i never had this before i am not a beginner anymore and i know what im doing. This is not the first time im starting a server and coding stuff.

Any of you know what this problem is about?

Thanks

PS: Portforwarding with uTorrent (just for myself), always worked fine but now. Just thought i should tell you

EDIT: I just found a cool working portforwarding program, called soulseek. You can portforward with that if you dont have a router, it fixed my stuff that i had with utorrent
